info.official_title: T-reg Function Changes: a Novel Immune Regulatory Effect Underlying Benefit of Statin Use on Lethal Prostate Cancer
info.inclusion_criteria:
1. Men with pathologically-confirmed localized prostate cancer determined to be intermediate (stage T2b, or Gleason 7, or PSA 10-20 ng/mL) or high risk (stage T2c, or PSA >/=20 ng/mL, or Gleason >/=8) of biochemical recurrence at the time of biopsy
2. Electing to undergo prostatectomy;
3. Ability to provide written informed consent and willing to complete study procedures.
Healthy volunteers allowed
Must be MALE
Must have minimum age of 18 Years

identified_line.line: Healthy volunteers allowed
2. Electing to undergo prostatectomy;
Must be MALE

1. Men with pathologically-confirmed localized prostate cancer determined to be intermediate (stage T2b, or Gleason 7, or PSA 10-20 ng/mL) or high risk (stage T2c, or PSA >/=20 ng/mL, or Gleason >/=8) of biochemical recurrence at the time of biopsy

and_criteria.exact_snippets: Ability to provide written informed consent

identified_line.line: * Danazol
4. Men with low-density lipoprotein cholesterol <50mg/dL
12. Chronic liver disease (hepatitis or cirrhosis) or abnormal liver function (>1.5x clinical laboratory's upper limit of normal alanine aminotransferase);

criterions.exact_snippets: abnormal liver function (>1.5x clinical laboratory's upper limit of normal alanine aminotransferase)

or_criteria.exact_snippets: abnormal liver function (>1.5x clinical laboratory's upper limit of normal alanine aminotransferase)

identified_line.line: 2. Current use of medications contraindicated for concomitant use with 40mg simvastatin:

criterions.exact_snippets: Current use of medications contraindicated for concomitant use with 40mg simvastatin
criterions.criterion: use of contraindicated medications with simvastatin

criterions.exact_snippets: Current use of medications contraindicated for concomitant use with 40mg simvastatin
criterions.criterion: use of contraindicated medications with simvastatin

and_criteria.exact_snippets: Current use of medications contraindicated for concomitant use with 40mg simvastatin
and_criteria.criterion: use of contraindicated medications with simvastatin

identified_line.line: 11. Prior myocardial infarction or stroke
* Amiodarone
* Cyclosporine
6. Discontinued statin use because of statin-related adverse event;
14. History of myopathy or inflammatory muscle disease (>3x clinical laboratory's upper limit of normal creatine kinase).

criterions.exact_snippets: >3x clinical laboratory's upper limit of normal creatine kinase

and_criteria.exact_snippets: >3x clinical laboratory's upper limit of normal creatine kinase
>3x clinical laboratory's upper limit of normal creatine kinase

identified_line.line: 10. Diagnosed diabetes or currently taking diabetes medications
8. Prior neoadjuvant or adjuvant chemotherapy, hormone therapy, or radiation therapy;
5. Statin use in the previous 12 months;

criterions.exact_snippets: Statin use in the previous 12 months

and_criteria.exact_snippets: Statin use in the previous 12 months

identified_line.line: * Diltiazem
* Gemfibrozil
* Ranolazine
3. Current use of medications requiring lower dose of simvastatin not already listed as exclusions criteria:

criterions.exact_snippets: Current use of medications requiring lower dose of simvastatin

and_criteria.exact_snippets: Current use of medications requiring lower dose of simvastatin

identified_line.line: * Verapamil
7. Evidence or suspicion of metastases;
9. History of non-prostate cancer other than non-melanoma skin cancer in the last 24 months;

criterions.exact_snippets: History of non-prostate cancer other than non-melanoma skin cancer in the last 24 months
criterions.criterion: history of non-prostate cancer (excluding non-melanoma skin cancer)

and_criteria.exact_snippets: History of non-prostate cancer other than non-melanoma skin cancer in the last 24 months
and_criteria.criterion: history of non-prostate cancer (excluding non-melanoma skin cancer)

identified_line.line: * Calcium channel blockers: verapamil; diltiazem; amlodipine

criterions.exact_snippets: Calcium channel blockers: verapamil; diltiazem; amlodipine

identified_line.line: 13. Stage 4 or 5 chronic kidney disease (Creatinine clearance / estimated glomerular filtration rate < 30 mL/min calculated by Cockgroft-Gault formula);

criterions.exact_snippets: Creatinine clearance / estimated glomerular filtration rate < 30 mL/min calculated by Cockgroft-Gault formula
criterions.criterion: creatinine clearance or estimated glomerular filtration rate

criterions.exact_snippets: Creatinine clearance / estimated glomerular filtration rate < 30 mL/min calculated by Cockgroft-Gault formula
criterions.criterion: creatinine clearance or estimated glomerular filtration rate

identified_line.line: * CYP3A4 inhibitors: itraconazole; ketoconazole; posaconazole; erythromycin; clarithromycin; telithromycin; HIV protease inhibitors; boceprevir; telaprevir; nefazodone

criterions.exact_snippets: CYP3A4 inhibitors: itraconazole; ketoconazole; posaconazole; erythromycin; clarithromycin; telithromycin; HIV protease inhibitors; boceprevir; telaprevir; nefazodone

identified_line.line: 1. Current statin use or use of non-statin lipid-lowering drug (fibrates, bile acid sequestrants, or niacin);

criterions.exact_snippets: use of non-statin lipid-lowering drug (fibrates, bile acid sequestrants, or niacin)
use of non-statin lipid-lowering drug (fibrates, bile acid sequestrants, or niacin)
